An Iranian businessman accused of conducting financial transactions that violated U.S. sanctions has pleaded guilty, the U.S. Justice Department said Tuesday. Seyed Sajjad Shahidian, founder and former chief executive of Iranian online financial services company Payment24, in May pleaded not guilty in federal court in Minnesota after being arrested and extradited from the U.K., according to court documents. Mr. Shahidian, in a videoconference Tuesday, changed his plea for one count of conspiracy to defraud and commit offenses against the U.S.

Link to the article on The Wall Street Journal.
